Class GameZone

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameZone

  • public class GameZone
extends java.lang.Object
    This program allows the user to select from 2 game options: 21 or rock paper scissors. They may play each game as many times as they like, unless they choose to quit. Note: the 21 game is simulated assuming there is an infinite deck of cards.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameZone() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main function that executes whichever game the user chooses continuously until the user enters a 3 to quit.

      This function simulates a game of 21 with an infinite deck.
      static void playRockPaperScissors(java.util.Random rnd)
      This function simulates a classic game of rock, paper, scissors.

      This function presents a menu with 3 choices to the user and returns the integer of their choice.

    • Method Detail

      • printWelcome

        public static void printWelcome()
        This function prints a welcome banner.

      • printMenuAndGetChoice

        public static int printMenuAndGetChoice(java.util.Scanner sc)
        This function presents a menu with 3 choices to the user and returns the integer of their choice. Note: the user will repeatedly be presented with the menu of options until they enter a character within the range 1-3.
        Parameters:
        sc - The scanner object used to read user's choice
        Returns:
        The integer user chooses

      • play21

        public static void play21(java.util.Scanner sc,
                          java.util.Random rnd)
        This function simulates a game of 21 with an infinite deck. The user can choose to draw cards as long as their total does not meet or exceed 21. If their total exceeds 21, they lose. If their total reaches 21 exactly, they win. If their total is less than 21 and they choose to stop drawing cards, they will win. if their total is greater than the computer, lose if their total is less than the computer, or tie otherwise.
        Parameters:
        sc - The scanner object used to read user's choice
        rnd - The random object used to select card totals for user and computer

      • playRockPaperScissors

        public static void playRockPaperScissors(java.util.Random rnd)
        This function simulates a classic game of rock, paper, scissors. The computer and user will randomly be assigned rock, paper, or scissors. The winner will then be determined based on the usual rules.
        Parameters:
        rnd - The random object used to select rock, paper, or scissors

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main function that executes whichever game the user chooses continuously until the user enters a 3 to quit.
